intro: Sahlbergia, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their small, fleshy leaves and unique, fig-like fruits that are often enclosed in a tough, woody capsule. Sahlbergia species typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Their ecological importance includes providing food for various wildlife species and contributing to the biodiversity of their native habitats.
